required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dose Escalation/Dose Expansion Study of YBL-006 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open-Label, Multicenter, Single Arm, Dose Escalation/Dose Expansion Study of YBL-006 in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1, open-label, multicenter, dose-escalation/dose-expansion study of YBL-006. This multicenter study will be conducted in approximately 18-24 patients in the dose escalation phase, and up to more than 80 patients in dose expansion phase.

detailed_description.textblock:
study will consist of three periods:
1. Screening (up to 28 days)
2. Treatment (28-day cycles)
3. Follow-up (up to 3 months)
Dose Escalation:
An accelerated titration design will be utilized for the lowest dose cohort (0.5 mg/kg) in the dose escalation part. Whereas the traditional 3 + 3 design will be utilized for the higher dose cohorts until the RP2D is determined.
Expansion Cohorts:
Enrollment in expansion cohort will begin when the RP2D has been identified by the CoRC. Up to four tumor-specific cohorts consisting of approximately 16-20 patients per cohort will evaluate the safety, efficacy, PK, and PD of YBL-006 at the RP2D.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability measure through Adverse Events/Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
primary_outcome.description: Treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v5.0 or higher

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability(Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events) measure through Vital Sign- blood pressure
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by result of the Vital Sign- blood pressure

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability(Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events) measure through Vital Sign-heart rate
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by result of the Vital Sign- heart rate

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability(Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events) measure through 12-lead ECG
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by result of the ECG QT Interval

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability(Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events) measure through Physical exam
primary_outcome.time_frame: Measurements at Baseline till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
primary_outcome.description: Measured by result of the physical exam which includes general appearance, skin, eyes/ears/nose/throat, head and neck.

primary_outcome.measure: To establish the recommended Phase 2 dose (RP2D) of YBL-006 in patients with advanced solid tumors
primary_outcome.description: Measured through increase in anti-drug antibody (ADA) levels

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at C1D1 till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
secondary_outcome.description: PK is assessed by parameter- area under the curve (AUC)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at Cycle1(each cycle is 28 days) Day1 till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
secondary_outcome.description: PK is assessed by parameter- maximum (or peak) serum concentration (Cmax)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at Cycle1(each cycle is 28 days) Day1 till Follow up from 90 days of last dose
secondary_outcome.description: PK is assessed by parameter- time of peak concentration (Tmax)

arm_group.description: YBL-006 will be administered once every 2 weeks (Q2W). Dose: 0.5 mg/kg
YBL-006 will be administered once every 2 weeks (Q2W). Dose: 2 mg/kg
YBL-006 will be administered once every 2 weeks (Q2W). Dose: 5 mg/kg
YBL-006 will be administered once every 2 weeks (Q2W). Dose: 10 mg/kg

intervention.description: Route of Administration: IV infusion; 0.5 mg/kg Q2W
Route of Administration: IV infusion; 2 mg/kg Q2W
Route of Administration: IV infusion; 5 mg/kg Q2W
Route of Administration: IV infusion; 10 mg/kg Q2W
